data.text: #Aruba's new banknotes have no images of famous leaders, but spotlight its flora and fauna in vibrant colors – and won international acclaim for their designs. Read more in the latest F&D magazine: https://t.co/HChLidko7U https://t.co/uC4xS7MxuB
Despite being more educated than their parents, #millennials may have less job stability during their working life. https://t.co/S4vdAhlWsK #IMFBlog #YouthDay https://t.co/fgamXeJQ7l
The $3.4 billion IMF emergency financing package for #Nigeria will support health care sector, protect jobs and businesses. https://t.co/OyA1kaREwK #IMFAfrica https://t.co/Akf278Lj9d

Jihad Azour, Director of the IMF’s Middle East and Central Asia Department, explains how the IMF continues to move swiftly to aid member countries during the #COVID19 pandemic amid falling oil prices and rising debt. Find out more at: https://t.co/JyEOMJSlt5 https://t.co/9b9G7qYnmL

What if the economy had shock absorbers like your car to prevent major shocks when the economy hits a pothole? And what if those shock absorbers could be installed before the economy runs into trouble? This video explains automatic stabilizers. https://t.co/CFZpOSw0F2 https://t.co/I4FfwQ0mO1
The IMF is fully committed to supporting our member countries, particularly the most vulnerable. Learn more here https://t.co/YjjfFMBey5 #COVID19 https://t.co/eWwAATog33

The IMF is providing emergency financial assistance and debt relief to member countries facing the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic. Find out which have so far received emergency financial assistance: https://t.co/lJlAHDqkKl https://t.co/IvOofpYyry

Trade barriers aren’t the answer to address persistent global imbalances, according to the new IMF External Sector Report. Instead, cooperation is needed for durable global rebalancing &to resolve trade tensions that endanger the recovery #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/PikqC83GGI https://t.co/8Ku1XBCx59

Women who lose jobs due to #COVID19 often have no safety net, because they are more likely to work in the informal sector, with no labor-law protections and no pension and health benefits. Read our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/sDllkbym35 #GenderEquality https://t.co/v47jndeWmR
After a century-long decline, mortality rates for middle-aged Americans have flattened or increased and #education has a lot to do with it. Listen to the latest @imf_podcast https://t.co/eawnPfMFik

.@NOAA’s latest update predicts an “extremely active” hurricane season, which is science speak for 🌀🌀🌀😱.  A warming planet is just one way we all feel the effects of #climatechange. Take a deep dive into all our climate change data and analysis here https://t.co/CyEVEK0a05 https://t.co/a4Dr5A345r
Corruption hurts everyone. Read more on #IMFBlog https://t.co/dxLRZzubVX https://t.co/s0Tb7MsR7y
What economic measures are governments taking to respond to #COVID19? Key actions taken by 196 countries are listed in our Policy Tracker: https://t.co/GSeyZRWAxk https://t.co/dKsVRbAEWR

IMF’s Weeks-Brown: You have to fix corruption by addressing the broader governance issues that allow corruption to thrive. That is why the IMF’s Framework for Enhanced Engagement on Governance aims to do this in our engagement with member countries. https://t.co/YsYi4rNFnY https://t.co/G8HbD1zo8X
What is #unemployment? We explain in this #BackToBasics video. https://t.co/ksr5zBdw9F
Is the IMF candid, evenhanded and effective with countries when it comes to anti-#corruption? Read our new report card to see if we make the grade on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/S8vmLq1QNF

Economies with large current account deficits, a high share of foreign currency debt, and limited international reserves could be at risk of crisis if investors suddenly withdraw. Read the latest #ESR Report https://t.co/uk0Nncg3OT #COVID19 https://t.co/K1rHMsN4AX
What can #policymakers do to support economic growth in aging societies? Find out in the #ChartOfTheWeek on #IMFBlog https://t.co/6LYEyg8FcO https://t.co/jUsdaJGN67

South Africa will implement economic reforms to drive growth over the medium term by modernizing network industries, reorienting trade policies and lowering entry barriers for new businesses, @TreasuryRSA's Mogajane says in new #IMFCountryFocus. https://t.co/l9buzDg7yT #IMFAfrica https://t.co/AhQovomZ2D
REPLAY: Discussion on the latest External Sector Report with @GitaGopinath. #ESR @OMFIF https://t.co/0n7jGENBCv
Increasing government spending to revive the economy may be less effective in aging societies compared to younger ones. Read more in #IMFBlog https://t.co/6LYEyg8FcO https://t.co/OJCXOz0pjE

Rwanda is leveraging grass roots networks and using digital solutions to fight the spread of #COVID19 through contact tracing, surveillance, robotics and data visualization, @RwandaFinance's Tusabe tells #IMFCountryFocus. https://t.co/q5NuqUw62e

IMF researchers show that #pandemics progressively widen gap between rich and poor, as measured by the net Gini coefficient (#inequality measure). https://t.co/xisXkJg7fA #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/wSX7v8fpwO
Internet banking in Malaysia has quadrupled in the last decade, topping a 90% usage rate in 2018. #IMFCountryFocus looks at #Malaysia’s flourishing #fintech ecosystem. https://t.co/YXCY3g0PqP
What economic measures are governments taking to respond to #COVID19? Our Policy Tracker lists key actions taken by 193 countries. https://t.co/GSeyZRWAxk
How #Paraguay defeated #COVID19 and is betting on public investment and governance reforms to boost growth. #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/PSBXX9dtrK https://t.co/eNPA6RogLf
Emerging market economies are likely to face an economic uphill battle. Read about why in our new #IMFBlog #COVID19 #emergingmarkets https://t.co/iomV5xZ3zL https://t.co/0y7i8L0bHU

Rwanda is scaling up its locally driven social protection programs in response to #COVID19 by supporting households with food, cash transfers, agricultural inputs, and aid for shelter, health and education, @RwandaFinance's Tusabe tells #IMFCountryFocus. https://t.co/q5NuqUNHqO

Advanced economies’ policies provided emerging market economy policymakers with wiggle room to soften the economic blow of #COVID19. How is this time different from past crises? Some answers in our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/iomV5xZ3zL https://t.co/MIw3qpIkJA
.@KGeorgieva: “Gender equality doesn’t fall from the sky. It has to be written into policies, and it has to be fought for.” https://t.co/fkMa9hgPHM #InHerWords https://t.co/QF8PnBXAl8

The poor and the young in the lowest-paid jobs are least able to telework and most vulnerable to layoffs, furloughs or pay cuts. New IMF research shows that workers in hospitality, food, construction and transportation are at the highest risk. https://t.co/INQJG5zuZK #IMFBlog https://t.co/lNyoVwmjJb
The devastation #COVID19 caused in labor markets could hit women particularly hard and undo gains in gender equality made in recent decades. https://t.co/INQJG5R5Ri #IMFBlog

Until #COVID19, #Bangladesh’s economy had been experiencing robust growth. But the crisis has dealt an economic blow. New IMF emergency financing will help #Bangladesh with recovery, including spending needs on health and social protection. Read more: https://t.co/uFii1qTIen https://t.co/pbq7562clt

Trade barriers aren’t the answer to address persistent global imbalances, according to the new IMF External Sector Report. Instead, cooperation is needed for durable global rebalancing &to resolve trade tensions that endanger the recovery #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/PikqC83GGI https://t.co/kVN06sOV5e

Young workers and those without university education are significantly less likely to work remotely. This could amplify intergenerational #inequality. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/INQJG5zuZK https://t.co/tCyeUDamSp
Food systems are essential to economic activity, providing the energy we need to live and work. How can we improve them? https://t.co/hND9QOIoLg #IMFBlog #BuildForwardBetter

South Africa’s #COVID19 funding will be subject to auditing, transparency and procurement rules to ensure funds go where intended says @TreasuryRSA’s Mogajane in a new #IMFCountryFocus article. https://t.co/l9buzDg7yT #IMFAfrica https://t.co/G02OvX6lm9

It’s easier to work at home in Sweden and Singapore than in Mexico or Chile. More than half of houses in emerging countries don’t even have a computer. Amid #COVID19, IMF researchers ranked how ‘teleworkable’ are jobs in different countries. https://t.co/INQJG5zuZK #IMFBlog https://t.co/W2fCckcLFX

Like many tourism-dependent countries, #Montenegro has been hit hard from the effects of COVID-19. Read #IMFCountryFocus to find out how Montenegro is addressing the impact of COVID-19. https://t.co/p0L77RPtXi https://t.co/mizbmthkDF

In an interview with #IMFCountryFocus, Fikadu Digafe Huriso, Vice Governor and Chief Economist of the National Bank of Ethiopia describes the impact of #COVID19 on his country, and the measures which #Ethiopia is taking to combat the pandemic. https://t.co/VgsI6bpPkg #IMFAfrica https://t.co/VMPnKN3MiO
In #Malaysia, fintech is booming. #Fintech can help with financial inclusion while boosting a country’s economic growth. Learn more https://t.co/YXCY3g0PqP #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/qIWkg3yL8y

The Catastrophe Containment and Relief Trust (CCRT) allows the IMF to provide grants for #debt relief for the poorest and most vulnerable countries hit by catastrophic natural disasters or public health disasters. https://t.co/PW1zFitcDV https://t.co/aVgWUUSxgD

Internet banking in #Malaysia has quadrupled in the last decade, topping a 90% usage rate in 2018. Here is a look at Malaysia’s flourishing #fintech ecosystem. https://t.co/YXCY3fJe2f #IMFCountryFocus

The IMF's new External Sector Report highlights policies for supporting the recovery from the #COVID19 crisis in the near term and reforms for durable global rebalancing when the pandemic abates. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog. #ESR https://t.co/PikqC83GGI https://t.co/UjJQneM785

What are current account imbalances and what's their impact on the global economy? Our latest External Sector Report #ESR assesses external imbalances around the world. Read it here: https://t.co/ndkUcq9Wcq https://t.co/vlDpe9D2eq

The world entered the #COVID19 crisis with pre-existing external imbalances, leaving some economies vulnerable to external shocks and renewed trade tensions, the IMF’s Leigh and Kaufman write in an #IMFBlog on the new External Sector Report. #ESR https://t.co/orLKQGQStw https://t.co/WbZx0Ao2Tp

A disconnect between financial markets and the real economy has emerged with the #COVID19 pandemic, posing a risk to the recovery should investors’ attitude change and cause a correction. Read more on the #IMFBlog: https://t.co/ABEsjgYcpy #GFSR

South Africa will use IMF emergency funding to support economy during #COVID19, boost healthcare spending and extend social support payments, @TreasuryRSA's Mogajane explains in our latest #IMFCountryFocus. https://t.co/l9buzDg7yT #IMFAfrica https://t.co/7zncPl79p6

The IMF has significantly increased its focus on helping countries tackle #corruption over the last years. In 2018, we adopted an enhanced framework designed to facilitate a more candid & effective dialogue w/ countries. Learn about the progress we made.
https://t.co/rlP87LbXPY https://t.co/oAiQ7qEPyI

The IMF’s central bank transparency code was developed with extensive input from central banks, international institutions and standard-setters. It lays out a set of practices applicable to all countries, regardless of income levels and circumstances. https://t.co/Pgr38Szbi0

Today's IMF #WeekendRead newsletter focuses on rising #debt levels around the world, income and gender #inequality, cracking down on corruption amidst the pandemic, and more. Read and subscribe for weekly updates: https://t.co/McvDLMOH2Z https://t.co/Ky5D8XcKe5
